text.text_translated: Scientists have more questions about how genes affect our brain and our language. A gene is a small part of your body. It tells your body how to grow and work. Scientists ask if some genes changed and gave us the skill for language. They found a change in one gene. This change happened a long time ago. It happened between 200,000 and 100,000 years ago. This gene change seems to be connected with speaking. It is connected to how our brain controls our mouth and face. Monkeys have a similar gene. But their gene did not change in this way. It is too early to know how much genes affect language. But maybe one day we will find the answers in our DNA.
